cat.title: Communications Toolbox Support Package for Analog Devices ADALM-Pluto Radio
Get Started with Communications Toolbox Support Package for Analog Devices ADALM-Pluto Radio

ref.name: Spectrum Analysis of Signals
ref.alt: Spectrum Analysis of Signals
ref.sum: Downstream spectrum analysis of signals using MATLAB®, Communications Toolbox™ and DSP System Toolbox™. You can either use captured signals, or receive signals in real time using the RTL-SDR Radio, ADALM-PLUTO Radio or USRP™ Radio. You can change the radio's center frequency to tune the radio to a band where a signal is present. You can then use the spectrum analyzer to view and make measurements on the received spectrum.

ref.name: Spectrum Analysis of Signals in Simulink
ref.alt: Spectrum Analysis of Signals in Simulink
ref.sum: Use Simulink® and Communications Toolbox™ to perform spectrum analysis of the downstream signals. You can tune the radio to a band where a signal is present by changing the center frequency. You can then use the spectrum analyzer to view and make measurements on the received spectrum. You can either use recorded data from a file, or receive over-the-air signals in real time using an RTL-SDR radio, ADALM-PLUTO radio, or USRP™ radio.

ref.name: FM Broadcast Receiver
ref.alt: FM Broadcast Receiver
ref.sum: Build an FM mono or stereo receiver using MATLAB® and Communications Toolbox™. You can either use captured signals, or receive signals in real time using the RTL-SDR Radio, ADALM-PLUTO Radio or USRP™ Radio.

ref.name: RDS/RBDS and RadioText Plus (RT+) FM Receiver
ref.alt: RDS/RBDS and RadioText Plus (RT+) FM Receiver
ref.sum: Extract program or song information from FM radio stations using the RDS or RBDS standard and, optionally, the RadioText Plus (RT+) standard. You can use a captured signal, or receive signals over-the-air in real time using an RTL-SDR radio, an ADALM-PLUTO radio, or a USRP B200/B210 radio.

ref.name: Capture RF Data to Baseband File Using ADALM-PLUTO Radio
ref.alt: Capture RF Data to Baseband File Using ADALM-PLUTO Radio
ref.sum: Use the capture function and an ADALM-PLUTO radio to record RF signals for post-capture processing in MATLAB®. Save an FM broadcast signal to a file as baseband samples. Read the file containing the recorded signal and demodulate the baseband samples.

ref.name: Spectrum Analysis of Signals
ref.alt: Spectrum Analysis of Signals
ref.sum: Downstream spectrum analysis of signals using MATLAB®, Communications Toolbox™ and DSP System Toolbox™. You can either use captured signals, or receive signals in real time using the RTL-SDR Radio, ADALM-PLUTO Radio or USRP™ Radio. You can change the radio's center frequency to tune the radio to a band where a signal is present. You can then use the spectrum analyzer to view and make measurements on the received spectrum.

ref.name: Spectrum Analysis of Signals in Simulink
ref.alt: Spectrum Analysis of Signals in Simulink
ref.sum: Use Simulink® and Communications Toolbox™ to perform spectrum analysis of the downstream signals. You can tune the radio to a band where a signal is present by changing the center frequency. You can then use the spectrum analyzer to view and make measurements on the received spectrum. You can either use recorded data from a file, or receive over-the-air signals in real time using an RTL-SDR radio, ADALM-PLUTO radio, or USRP™ radio.

ref.name: Frequency Correction for ADALM-PLUTO Radio in Simulink
ref.alt: Frequency Correction for ADALM-PLUTO Radio in Simulink
ref.sum: Synchronize both the baseband sample rate and the center frequency of two PlutoSDRs by using the Frequency correction parameter of the ADALM-PLUTO Radio Receiver block.

ref.name: Frequency Correction for ADALM-PLUTO Radio
ref.alt: Frequency Correction for ADALM-PLUTO Radio
ref.sum: Synchronize both the baseband sample rate and the center frequency of two PlutoSDRs by using the FrequencyCorrection property of comm.SDRRxPluto and comm.SDRTxPluto.

ref.name: Frequency Offset Calibration with ADALM-PLUTO Radio in Simulink
ref.alt: Frequency Offset Calibration with ADALM-PLUTO Radio in Simulink
ref.sum: These two models show how to determine the relative frequency offset between two ADALM-PLUTO radios.

ref.name: QPSK Transmitter with ADALM-PLUTO Radio
ref.alt: QPSK Transmitter with ADALM-PLUTO Radio
ref.sum: Use the ADALM-PLUTO Radio System objects to implement a QPSK transmitter. The ADALM-PLUTO radio in this system will keep transmitting indexed "Hello world" messages at its specified center frequency. You can demodulate the transmitted message using the QPSK Receiver with ADALM-PLUTO Radio example. This example assumes that two ADALM-PLUTO radios are attached to your computer.

ref.name: QPSK Transmitter with ADALM-PLUTO Radio in Simulink
ref.alt: QPSK Transmitter with ADALM-PLUTO Radio in Simulink
ref.sum: How to use the ADALM-PLUTO Radio with Simulink® to implement a QPSK transmitter. The ADALM-PLUTO Radio in this model will keep transmitting indexed 'Hello world' messages at its specified center frequency. You can demodulate the transmitted message using the QPSK Receiver with ADALM-PLUTO Radio model. This example assumes that two ADALM-PLUTO Radios are attached to your computer.

ref.name: QPSK Receiver with ADALM-PLUTO Radio
ref.alt: QPSK Receiver with ADALM-PLUTO Radio
ref.sum: Use the ADALM-PLUTO Radio System objects to implement a QPSK receiver. The receiver addresses practical issues in wireless communications, such as carrier frequency and phase offset, timing offset and frame synchronization. This system receives the signal sent by the QPSK Transmitter with ADALM-PLUTO Radio example. The receiver demodulates the received symbols and prints a simple message to the MATLAB® command line.

ref.name: QPSK Receiver with ADALM-PLUTO Radio in Simulink
ref.alt: QPSK Receiver with ADALM-PLUTO Radio in Simulink
ref.sum: How to use the the ADALM-PLUTO Radio with Simulink® to implement a QPSK receiver. The receiver addresses practical issues in wireless communications, e.g. carrier frequency and phase offset, timing offset and frame synchronization. This model receives the signal sent by the QPSK Transmitter with ADALM-PLUTO Radio model. The receiver demodulates the received symbols and outputs a simple message to the MATLAB® command line.

ref.name: Capture RF Data to Baseband File Using ADALM-PLUTO Radio
ref.alt: Capture RF Data to Baseband File Using ADALM-PLUTO Radio
ref.sum: Use the capture function and an ADALM-PLUTO radio to record RF signals for post-capture processing in MATLAB®. Save an FM broadcast signal to a file as baseband samples. Read the file containing the recorded signal and demodulate the baseband samples.

ref.name: Airplane Tracking Using ADS-B Signals
ref.alt: Airplane Tracking Using ADS-B Signals
ref.sum: Track planes by processing automatic dependent surveillance-broadcast (ADS-B) signals using MATLAB® and Communications Toolbox™. You can use captured signals or receive signals in real time using an RTL-SDR radio, ADALM-PLUTO radio or Universal Software Radio Peripheral (USRP™) radio. You can also visualize the tracked planes on a map using the Mapping Toolbox™ software.

ref.name: Airplane Tracking Using ADS-B Signals in Simulink
ref.alt: Airplane Tracking Using ADS-B Signals in Simulink
ref.sum: Track planes by processing automatic dependent surveillance-broadcast (ADS-B) signals using Simulink® and Communications Toolbox™. You can use captured and saved signals, or receive signals in real time using an RTL-SDR radio, an ADALM-PLUTO radio or a Universal Software Radio Peripheral (USRP™) radio. You can also visualize the tracked planes on a map, if you have the Mapping Toolbox™ software.

ref.name: FM Broadcast Receiver
ref.alt: FM Broadcast Receiver
ref.sum: Build an FM mono or stereo receiver using MATLAB® and Communications Toolbox™. You can either use captured signals, or receive signals in real time using the RTL-SDR Radio, ADALM-PLUTO Radio or USRP™ Radio.

ref.name: FM Broadcast Receiver in Simulink
ref.alt: FM Broadcast Receiver in Simulink
ref.sum: Build an FM mono or stereo receiver using Simulink® and Communications Toolbox™. You can either use captured signals, or receive signals in real time using the RTL-SDR, ADALM-PLUTO or USRP radio.

ref.name: RDS/RBDS and RadioText Plus (RT+) FM Receiver
ref.alt: RDS/RBDS and RadioText Plus (RT+) FM Receiver
ref.sum: Extract program or song information from FM radio stations using the RDS or RBDS standard and, optionally, the RadioText Plus (RT+) standard. You can use a captured signal, or receive signals over-the-air in real time using an RTL-SDR radio, an ADALM-PLUTO radio, or a USRP B200/B210 radio.

ref.name: RDS/RBDS and RadioText Plus (RT+) FM Receiver in Simulink
ref.alt: RDS/RBDS and RadioText Plus (RT+) FM Receiver in Simulink
ref.sum: Extract program or song information from FM radio stations using the RDS or RBDS standard and, optionally, the RadioText Plus (RT+) standard. You can use a captured signal, or receive signals over-the-air in real time using an RTL-SDR radio, an ADALM-PLUTO radio, or a USRP B200/B210 radio.

ref.name: Image Transmission and Reception Using 802.11 Waveform and SDR
ref.alt: Image Transmission and Reception Using 802.11 Waveform and SDR
ref.sum: Encode and pack an image file into WLAN packets for transmission and subsequently decode the packets to retrieve the image. The example also shows how to use a software-defined radio (SDR) for over-the-air transmission and reception of the WLAN packets.

ref.name: Image Transmission and Reception Using LTE Waveform and SDR
ref.alt: Image Transmission and Reception Using LTE Waveform and SDR
ref.sum: Transmit and receive an image using an LTE waveform and a software-defined radio (SDR). The example generates a single or multi-antenna LTE waveform for simultaneous transmission and reception on a single SDR platform. During waveform generation, the example encodes and packs an image into a radio frame. Then, on reception, the example decodes the image from the received LTE waveform.

ref.name: Automatic Meter Reading
ref.alt: Automatic Meter Reading
ref.sum: Use Communications Toolbox™ to read utility meters by processing Standard Consumption Message (SCM) signals and Interval Data Message (IDM) signals which are emitted by Encoder-Receiver-Transmitter (ERT) compatible meters. You can either use recorded data from a file, or receive over-the-air signals in real time using an RTL-SDR or ADALM-PLUTO radio.

ref.name: Automatic Meter Reading in Simulink
ref.alt: Automatic Meter Reading in Simulink
ref.sum: Use Simulink® and Communications Toolbox™ to read utility meters by processing Standard Consumption Message (SCM) or Interval Data Message (IDM) signals emitted by meters. You can either use recorded data from a file, or receive over-the-air signals in real time using the RTL-SDR Radio or ADALM-PLUTO Radio.

ref.name: Spectrum Sensing with Deep Learning to Identify 5G and LTE Signals
ref.alt: Spectrum Sensing with Deep Learning to Identify 5G and LTE Signals
ref.sum: Train a semantic segmentation network using deep learning for spectrum monitoring. One of the uses of spectrum monitoring is to characterize spectrum occupancy. The neural network in this example is trained to identify 5G NR and LTE signals in a wideband spectrogram.

ref.name: LTE Transmitter Using Software Defined Radio
ref.alt: LTE Transmitter Using Software Defined Radio
ref.sum: Generate a reference measurement channel (RMC) downlink (DL) LTE waveform suitable for over-the-air transmission. This example also shows how to use a software-defined radio (SDR) to transmit the generated waveform using single or multiple antennas.

ref.name: LTE Receiver Using Software Defined Radio
ref.alt: LTE Receiver Using Software Defined Radio
ref.sum: Recover the master information block (MIB) and basic system information from an over-the-air LTE downlink (DL) waveform. This example also shows how to receive an LTE waveform using a software-defined radio (SDR) with single or multiple antennas.

ref.name: Ship Tracking Using AIS Signals
ref.alt: Ship Tracking Using AIS Signals
ref.sum: Track ships by processing automatic identification system (AIS) signals. You can use captured signals or receive signals in real time using an RTL-SDR radio, an ADALM-PLUTO radio or a USRP™ Radio . You can also show the tracked ships on a map using the Mapping Toolbox™.

cat.title: Troubleshooting in Communications Toolbox Support Package for Analog Devices ADALM-Pluto Radio
